Key Match Events: De’Aaron Fox scored 33 points, leading the Sacramento Kings to a 110-100 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
The Kings went on a 17-2 run to end the third quarter, taking an 83-77 lead.
Sacramento started the fourth quarter on an 11-4 run, extending their lead to double digits with a 3-pointer by Trey Lyles.
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie secured his first win as the interim head coach of the Sacramento Kings after the team fired Mike Brown last week.
